title: Fitness Tracker: Determining Shape from a 5-Number Summary
question_text:
For several months now, Wally has been using a fitness tracker to keep track of how many steps he takes each day. From data that he has collected, he calculated the $5$-number summary to be:
$\text{Min}: 3190$ $\text{Q1}: 6423$ $\text{Med}: 7807$ $\text{Q3}: 9672$ $\text{Max}: 17210$
Wally wants to make a boxplot so that he can determine the shape of the distribution. Unfortunately, he walked $17210$ steps today and is too tired to create the boxplot! Wanda tells Wally not to worry. She can determine the shape of the distribution from the $5$-number summary using all the data available.
What would Wanda tell Wally?

choices.text: The distribution is roughly symmetric, but not near normal..
A $5$-number summary can never determine the shape of the distribution .
